attributes.action: Oppose the expansion of the Tesco supermarket in Wolverton, Milton Keynes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Tesco are seeking to demolish an existing store in Wolverton and replace it with a Tesco Extra store.

This proposal should be opposed for a number of reasons:

Tesco have over 50% of the grocery market share in Milton Keynes.

Tesco dominates the local economy in Wolverton; an expanded store will simply lead to the closure of a further number of local independent traders.

A larger store will adversely affect people of limited mobility who can get round the current Wolverton store in one go. 

Tesco claim that their store is "over-shopped", but the movement around the store can be remedied without the need for expansion. 

Tesco should allow people the opportunity to shop in a medium sized store - if people want to shop in a Tesco superstore, they have two stores within short driving distance from Wolverton. 

The expansion of Tesco in Wolverton is solely motivated by the need to protect profits, not for the benefit of the local community.

There have been precedents for refusing Town Centre expansions of this nature, and it is asked that the Planning Authority are supported in opposing this development.
